result.execSummary:
The defendant Elizabeth A. McCain-Vieira was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Forgery-Uttering, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.38(2).
  • Forgery-Uttering, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.38(2).
  • Forgery-Uttering, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.38(2).
  • Forgery-Uttering, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.38(2).
  • Identity Theft- Financial Gain, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.201(2)(a).
  • Identity Theft- Financial Gain, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.201(2)(a).
  • Identity Theft- Financial Gain, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.201(2)(a).
  • Identity Theft- Financial Gain, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.201(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Jail credit of 75 days if revoked.

If Probation or Extended Supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

miscConds.notes: No contact with DA, JS, any known drug dealers or drug users.  Not to consume, use or possess any illegal drugs non-prescribed drugs, alcohol or drug paraphernalia.  No entry into bars, taverns or liquor stores.
Maintain absolute sobriety.  Provide DNA sampl.e  Participate and successfully complete treatment court.
AODA and follow through with recommendations.

records.addlTxt: Notice of Completion of Representation
Probation Revoked - Sentenced to Co. Jail/HOC on 11/27/19
dated 11/12/19 from Rev. Dr. David K. Anderson to the Court on behalf of the Defendant.

09:33 AM.  Defendant Elizabeth A. McCain-Vieira in custody with Attorney Michael J Steuer.  Peter Rindal appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Agreement has been reached. Counsel stipulates to 8 Months Jail on each count (concurrent) with 158 days of sentence credit.
Victim/Witness statute complied with. Counsel makes statements regarding the stipulation.
Defense files letter from Rev. Dr. David K. Anderson on behalf of the Defendant. Defendant makes a statement to the Court.
Court sentences the Defendant to 8 Months of Jail with Huber on each count (concurrent) and grants 158 days of sentence credit.
